review: I have a roku streaming stick that I have been using for a while and I bought the fire tv stick because it seemed like a great deal. I have both the fire stick and the roku stick connected to the same wifi network on the same tv, so they are exactly the same distance away from the router. I have tested both the fire tv stick and the roku stick on many apps ranging from Netflix to streaming movies on my local network through plex. I have found that the fire tv stick is far less reliable than the roku stick. Whether it is on netflix, hulu, or plex the fire tv stick constantly stops to buffer this is not the case with the roku stick (I am not exaggerating). I suspected that the buffering may be due to my wireless router or ISP, but the roku has no problems, and streaming on my laptop also is flawless and I never have buffering problems, even when streaming 1080p video with full dolby sound.The buffering problem has got to a point where I stopped using the fire tv stick completely and rely solely on the roku streaming stick. The fire tv stick is glitchy and has become entirely unusable due to the buffering issues. I strongly recommend getting the roku stick instead. regardless of having far more apps its just a far more stable and streamlined product and you can watch amazon instant video on it. Yes the roku's UI isn't the fastest, but fire tv stick isn't much better even with a faster processor and more ram.
